channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Parking on pavement behind large planting bay by up to 5 cars., 12th August
item.description:
This problem was reported in 2023 but is still ongoing (ref. 5055370.) A group of cars park on the pavement behind the planter so hidden from the road. Depending on how many are there the area is unsafe for children to play, off limits to people with pushchairs and an obstruction to emergency vehicles. The cars vary in number but there is normally one or more there at most times of the day or night. They were ticketed a while ago but this hasn't deterred them.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Falmouth Road, Elephant and Castle, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Park Mead, DA16 at the bottom of the steps of the footbridge by over the A2, 12th August
item.description:
In Park Mead, DA16, near the bottom of the steps of the footbridge that goes over the A2 is a tall tree. The lower branches of this tree obscure the view of any cars driving along park mead towards the footbridge. This makes it very dangerous for a pedestrians who have come down the steps and are waiting to cross the road, to see any incoming traffic and likewise dangerous and difficult for drivers to see pedestrians.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Park Mead, Blendon, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: The pathway that runs parallel with East Rochester way, between lakeside close and wellan close, 12th August
item.description:
The bushes , brambles and trees inside Danson park are growing through the fence and are protruding up to a meter obstructing the pedestrian pathway, running parallel to the park. This reduces the width of the pathway making it difficult to pass others using it. The vegetation needs a good trim.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): East Rochester Way, Blendon, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Increased fly tipping / dumped clothing, 12th August
item.description:
Large amount of clothes fly tipped onto private abandoned property (11 Englefield Path), next to 20 Tillingbourne Green - spilling onto public pavement. Abandoned gated part of the property and constant fly tipping needs to be addressed - itâ€™s been a problem for years. Rats and foxes are causing issues to communal green and neighbours. Health hazard.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 16, Tillingbourne Green, Poverest, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Litter left on street, 12th August
item.description:
Every day there are garbage bags left on the footpath of Hearn Street as shown in the attached photo. These are vulnerable to foxes and rats, especially at night. Could we get a proper skip for people/businesses to better dispose of their rubbish/food in?

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Hearn Street, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: This lamp and the one at the back of property in the alley are so bright, 11th August
item.description:
This lamp and the one at the back of property in the alley are so bright They are a nuisance and serve no purpose being directly on top of house the one at front of property is extremely bright it comes through blackout blind still and the one at the back of property in alley is extremely bright and shines straight through my bedroom window these 2 lampposts do not need to be there

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Okehampton Crescent, East Wickham, London
Report on FixMyStreet
